review_title: Alexx hyped us up that our song would…
review_content: Alexx hyped us up that our song would be a good fit for their playlist network. Ordered services and they could not place the song after 12 business days. Requested and received a refund. Time is money.UPDATE:11/28/2023Thanks for your response. We're perfectly aware of your terms. For us to wait and watch ⌚ 3 more days we figure what will those 3 days do that 12 days hadn't already. That's 3 days early that we can move that budget around. So, respectfully that we got an early refund we'll change our rating.

review_content: This course was a real turning point for me! It really helps to reach the right people, the ones who really like your music and then follow you, instead of just throwing money out and hoping you'll reach someone by chance.Now I can also actively engage with the marketing of the record label and tell them exactly what we want to spend our budget on.

review_content: Any product needs advertising to sell, music or beer, or dog food. In May 2023, I had zero listeners and followers on Spotify, now I have 530 listeners and 46 followers. Yes, learning and advertising for one’s music cost money, but music not listened to is silent music.

review_title: Not amazing and a bit suspicious
review_content: Overall it worked in a way, but very very suspicious. I’m on Official Editorial playlists and I see very very big differences on the data analysis. It seems so odd that the track I submitted to Indieacademy, got 300 streams a day and then boom, nothing. Regardless the fact that the playlist was very weird. I’m not an expert some people told me it looks fake, I really didn’t get any real engagement as I got on other playlists that has nothing to do with indiemusic, and the MAIN THING, It’s sooooooo expensive for what it is. There’s a lot to improve!

review_title: Spotify Growth Formula is an A+!
review_content: I have really enjoyed IMA's Spotify Growth Formula course. It has been 3 months, and we are almost finished. While my Spotify growth isn't where I'd hoped it would be by now, it definitely has increased, and I know it's going to get better as my ad creatives improve. More importantly, I have honestly learned so much about how to run PROPER Facebook ads. I have a much better understanding of the way things should be done and WHY they should be done that way. Ryan has been very hands-on, and he is not only knowledgeable, but also just a genuinely NICE guy. Thanks for your patience, Ryan. I know I was tough at times!

review_title: I've taken several courses at the Indie…
review_content: I've taken several courses at the Indie Music Academy. I started out as a member of the Indie Growth Coaching Community 3 years ago and found immense value in the Song Launch Formula, which was a course built into that community. I was also super impressed with Ryan Waczek's teaching and the amount of attention he gave each student. Later I took the Music Selling Through Storytelling course, which massively improved my copywriting skills and made all my communications with my fans better. Since then I've also used the IMA's Spotify promotion service and was very happy with the communication from the team. I had one of my songs placed within 2 days the first time and the second time it took a few months for my song to be placed (but I understand that's the nature of influencer marketing). Over all, my experience at the IMA has always been a 5 star one.

review_title: Not what I expected or hoped for, but ok overall.
review_content: So they do what they say they are going to do, they delivered the streams. However...they placed us on a playlist that was not a good fit for our music and threw off our algorithm/recommended artists/etc. They don't ask for any input as to what kind of playlists you want to be found on, similar artists/songs, etc.The communication from them was meh at best and all super automated and spammy, they are great at getting you to sign up, but not great at actually engaging with you. My advice to indie music academy: spend more time with your clients, automate less, and actual interact with customers. A lot of us try out the lowest package and are ready to spend more if we feel cared for and listened to.For anyone that wants reference tracks, band name is Six Foot Blonde, and track was Lady.edit: trying again with another track on their next tier, will update this review based on second experience.

review_title: Ryan Waczek and the Indie Music Academy are a Goldmine!
review_content: Ryan Waczek and the Indie Music Academy is -- hands down -- the best music training I have received as an independent songwriter/music artist in my attempt to set myself up for success in today’s digital music world. Ryan help me organize my entire ecosphere for royalty collection from ALL the possible sources. He taught me how to run successful FB ads, along with the importance of using those ads to build an email list of fans. He pounded home the need to create a fan journey, allowing potential fans to first begin to get to know me, then like me, and then trust me. And his 4-Week Song Release Calendar? I still use this invaluable tool for every song I release. Since starting to work with Ryan just three years ago, I’ve been able to SUCCESSFULLY release 11 new singles -- with 10 of the 11 playlisted on Spotify with real, generic streams. In the past 28 months, Ryan’s Spotify promotions have helped me go from 0 to more than 680,000 streams. A very happy musical camper I am!

review_title: This Course is Too Good
review_content: I've been refraining from giving this course a review until now, for selfish reasons. Why should I voluntarily give any of my competitors one "leg up"? But my moral conscience got the better of me.Granted I am self-admitted cynic and don't like to be marketed to. Ryan and his clan had been emailing me via autoresponder messages about several course promotions for over 18 months. The one time I didn't ignore or blow his team off, I wrote back directly and my attitude was not very nice. Until one day in late January 2023, I happened to see an ad for his Spotify Growth Formula (SGF), and for some inexplicable reason (was I on vacation and in a "good mood"?), I decided to "take a chance". What I found out quickly (and still am finding) is that SGF is too good. I'd never had prior success with ads. Quickly immersing myself completely in the content and never looking back, over the past 5 + months I've followed Ryan's amazing tutorials and calls to the "T", plus along with supplementing my own techniques using my own intuition, I have now become a Facebook Ads "Ninja"! My Facebook Ad Analytics have been "off the charts" and my Spotify has been steadily growing. The online community is also awesomely helpful, and I've learned even more by volunteering myself as a contributor. Plus, Ryan is a super nice guy, and interactive with the community.

review_title: The First & Best Move for any Indy Artist Begins Here
review_content: Firstly, I don't normally write reviews.Secondly, I'm a skeptic at heart, and not normally or easily impressed.  There are many, many DIY programs designed for independent artists these days.  But, in Ryan, you have not only found a tech/ marketing genius, you have not only found a fellow artist.. you have found an articulate, empathetic young man whose true calling in life is teaching, nurturing, and supporting fellow artists and like-minded souls.  Many online programs will tell you how many "thousands of dollars" can be made as an indy artist. But, Ryan has created a college-level course which actually walks you through the process step by step. You will not only learn basic marketing skills, you will not only learn how to navigate the Meta Facebook universe, but, you will also learn the very same marketing & business techniques used by record companies today to promote their artists. Ryan gives you the tools you need to be successful in today's market.  And he has also created a community of knowledgeable, artistic souls who are eager to help and offer guidance.I strongly urge every indy artist to sign up for this program.  Again.. I do not work for Ryan, and he is not paying me to say this. But, I'm gonna say this:  "If you are an indy artist and do not take this course, you are not giving yourself a real chance for success in this lifetime."  Hard work is important.But, "smart work" is the name of the game today.

review_title: The Place For Indie Artists
review_content: Ryan is great. One of the best people I’ve found helping Indie Artists find their way.I’ve been following Ryan and watching Indie Music Academy YouTube videos for over 2 years. He showed me how to spot and stay away from bot Spotify playlists, which distributors were right for our music and most recently taught me how to use Facebook ads to find the right audience for our music. I joined the first ever group for his Spotify Growth Formula class and have found it to be incredible. I’ve talked to many…many support reps at Facebook and no one knows more about the Facebook ads engine and how to strategize to find the best audience for your music than Ryan. I got so much out of the first Spotify Growth Formula class that I joined the second group and plan to continue meeting with Ryan and the other students in the community he’s set up for us to share what we’ve learned as we continue to become more experienced Facebook advertisers and musicians.Ryan is legit and gets results. You could not find a more trustworthy mentor – he cares and does everything he can to help his students move forward as they pursue their indie music careers.

review_content: Customer Service! Ryan and his team at the Indie Music Academy are simply the best in the business at answering every question (no matter how ignorant), giving encouragement (for even small successes), and teaching the crucial skills for online music distribution, promotion and connecting with fans around the world. Available, personal, educational, talented, and genuinely kind humans; this is my experience at Indie Music Academy. Thank you so much!

review_title: SFG - Spotify Growth Formula Course
review_content: SFG - Spotify Growth Formula Course.The real deal! Learnt how to get my songs in front of 100's of thousands of people, directly!! Which is miles better than doing playlist promotion.PL promo, where we gain passive streams through other peoples popular songs, is great for a boost in numbers, but this ( SGF ) is where it is at, seat of your pants stuff; Put the song(s) out and see if people like it, for real.   The Formula and setup works amazing and Ryans lessons are step by step and easy to follow.Put the music out there, to a LOT of people -  the results are down to us! I have full control and, more importantly, for me being a musician making songs just for the love of it, find out, for real, if people like it or not, which, with playlist promo, I never really knew.So doing both now, with the SGF course being the main thingGoodbye Record Labels and goodbye excuses! SGF gives us the pro tools to promote ourselves - biggest question is, now WE can do it,  "can we handle the truth" ha!.The technical side of the course opens the door to people to "audition" our songs, but can't force people to click over , stream , follow and all that.This is where the community comes in, spurring each other on to try new ideas and learning by sharing our experiences and results.

review_title: My experience was practical wasted…
review_content: My experience was practical wasted time. I had purchased a package for $537. After the purchase, my email account was bombarded with newsletter emails about their courses daily. But at first no problem. I had asked on 5th January, if I could get the placements sent to my email. I was answered 6 days later by "Mandy", which is a bit late. Thereupon I had also answered and again 6 days later an email received. I have to say that 6 days is too long. After my answer there was no answer from Mandy.Other companies respond within 24 or 72 hours. Therefore 0 stars in terms of contact. After 18 days and no answer I still had not received a single placement. Therefore, I have then finally requested a refund. Therefore also 0 stars in terms of promotion.I have to note that I still receive daily newsletter emails aimed at buying a course from them. I think this is the real strategy of the company, selling courses. My time was totally wasted, so not recommended.

review_title: Not getting what I paid for
review_content: After paying for the campaign, it started off promising by getting emails with helpful links and tips to get started. And then you get reassurances of getting onto real playlists with genuine streams. They state that you will get fully refunded if they can't get you on any playlist. Sounds good! I'm in! Where do I sign? Then I heard nothing for 2 weeks. All I get are impersonal generic emails which are the same that they send out to everyone I'm sure. I sent an email saying that "instead of asking for a refund, can we just switch songs for my campaign". Maybe I'll have better luck getting placements for it....no response from anyone for 3 business days. You figure surely someone can check an email and respond by then right? Then I get another generic email saying "how's everything going? If you need anything please don't hesitate to respond to this email" So I responded with my frustration with the process thus far and would just like a refund at this point. Still haven't heard back from this email either. Why send a generic email and not deliver on its contents? Very frustrating and I feel like I can't get in touch with anyone to help resolve my issue. So far I've spent over $200 for my campaign and feel like I've been ripped off.
